title: Title
title_description: Enter the full title of the study
short_title_description: Enter optional acronym/short title for the study
statement_of_accuracy_description: I confirm that the information provided in this form is true, complete and accurate
original_animal_ethics_committee_applica: Original animal ethics committee application or number of application
investigators_blinded_intervention_descr: Are the investigators involved in the experiment blinded to the allocation of the animals to the experimental groups?
investigators_blinded_assessment_descrip: Are the investigators blinded at the time of assessments of outcome(s)?
application_field_description: Please provide a link to an online copy of the animal ethics committee application or provide the number of the application
contact_name_description: Give the name of the main administrative contact for the study
contact_role_description: What is the role the main contact in the study (e.g. executive researcher, research group supervisor)?
contact_email_description: Provide the email address of the main contact
start_date_description: The date the study started or is expected to start
end_date_description: The date the study ended or is expected to end
yes_embargo: Embargo the details of this study
no_embargo: I do not want the details of this study embargoed
embargo_description: You may choose to embargo the details of this study (initially for 1 year)
exclusive_animal_use: Are animals exclusively used for this research question?
exclusive_animal_use_description: Please indicate if the animals (or tissues) are used for this study only
experimental_design_description:
Provide a description of the design and protocol, including:

  • What animal model will be used for the study
  • Experimental unit (e.g., individual animal, cage, litter, ten molars of one dog)
  • Strategy to minimize potential confounders (e.g., order of treatments and measurements, animal/cage location). If there is none, please state so.
  • Housing conditions and acclimatisation period(s).
hypothesis_description: Give the research question/hypothesis or problem the study investigates and state clearly why it is important to carry out this study
case_intervention_type: In case of intervention, Intervention type
intervention_type_description: What type of intervention is being tested in the study?
placebo_controlled_description: Was one of the arms of the study a placebo arm?
link_to_data_description: Please provide links to any related published articles, or data provided in any data repository (e.g. Dataverse, Open Science Framework, Figshare, Zenodo)
other_species_description: What other species did you use?
primary_readout_parameter_description: What is the primary readout parameter of the study? Please clarify what will be measured, how this will be measured and at what timepoint (e.g. efficacy based on Left Ventricular Ejection Fraction after 4 weeks).
secondary_readout_parameter_description: What is/are the secondary readout parameter(s) of the study?
randomisation_description:
Provide details about the study randomization


Are the animals randomly allocated to the experimental groups?
no_randomisation_description: Please explain why randomisation was not performed
research_field_description: To what research field does this study relate? (e.g. cardiology, oncology, neuroscience)
sample_size_calculation: Justify number of animals/Sample size calculation
sample_size_calculation_description: Please indicate if a sample size calculation was performed in advance and if so, please specify the sample size calculation. This typically includes alpha, beta, minimal detectable difference and expected number of drop-outs (due to mortality or other causes).
no_sample_size_details: Please explain why sample size calculation was not performed
sum_of_animals_description: Indicate the total number of animals which are expected to be analysed in total (exclude expected procedural drop-out)
sex_description: Indicate the sex of the animals in the study
species_description: Select the appropriate species for the study
study_stage_1_description: Hypothesis-generating research. Normally pilot studies are stage 1 studies.
study_stage_2_description: Final study confirming (or rejecting) a single hypothesis, these are normally blinded, randomized, controlled trials
study_stage_description: Please indicate the stage of the study
study_status_description: Please indicate what the current status of the study is
strain_description: Provide the strain or other specifications on the species
study_arms_description:
Please indicate all of the study arms/groups and their purpose

In the number column please indicate the number of animals per arm or group. Make sure that the sum of all groups together is equal to the total number given in item 19.

To note: if you register several experiments in this protocol, please specify in the text box intervention 'exp 1', 'exp2' followed by the name of the intervention, e.g. 'exp 1 - placebo control'
study_arms_extra_info:
Example 1
Control10Regular diet (Chow diet)
Control10Positive control - high fat diet
Intervention10High fat diet + DDP4 inhibitor (10mg/kg)
Example 2
Control15Remained in cage
Sham15Sham Ovariectomy
Intervention15Ovariectomy
study_centre_description: Give the details of the institutions where the experiments will be undertaken. Add additional lines if there is more than one
financial_support_description: Give the sources of financial support for the study
terms_conditions_description: I have read the terms and conditions and agree to be bound by them

details_randomisation: Further details on randomisation - Provide further details on randomisation.
subtitle: Subtitle
contact_you_shortly: We will contact you as soon as possible to answer your query.

why_reject_embargo_extension: Please let the user know why you rejected the current request for embargo extension.
make_sure_to_check_following_fields: Make sure to check the following fields.
fc3r_import_description: Your data were uploaded and translated, please fill the remaining empty fields in English.
additional_information_description:
Please give any other information about the study that is not covered elsewhere in the Form, such as:

  • inclusion/exclusion criteria used for animals or experimental units during the experiments and/or for data points during analysis
  • Statistical plan (e.g., tests planned, software(s) you will use)
  • How to assess whether the data met the assumptions of the statistical approach.
additional_animal_use_description: Please explain what the animals/tissues are used for in addition to the current research question
yes_sample_size_calculation_description: Please specify the sample size calculation
no_sample_size_calculation_description: Please explain why a sample size calculation was not performed
why_no_blinding: Please explain why blinding was not performed
how_blinding: Explain how the investigators were blinded
title_info: Give me more information about the title please!
info_icon_study_stage:
In doubt, think about the following information:

  • If the goal of your study is to identify potential relationships between several variables/connect ideas to understand cause-effect
  • You have no prior assumptions or clear hypothesis
  • The study will result in new information/hypotheses to test.

This is an exploratory study
  • If the goal of your study is to confirm a pre-specified relationship/connection.
  • You want to see if a specified hypothesis is supported by data
  • You have a pre-specified hypothesis (that was generated by a pilot or another study).
  • The study will result in confirming or refuting your pre-specified hypothesis

This is a confirmatory study
info_icon_hypothesis: Example: This study aims to assess the effect of arginine supplemented diets on cognitive function in animal models of Alzheimer. This project is important to better understand the impact of nutrition on Alzheimer's disease and may help clinical studies in the future
info_icon_experimental_design:
Example with: animal models, experimental units, strategy to minimise confounders, housing condition and acclimatisation period

The study uses transgenic alzheimer’s mouse (XX) bought from Jackson’s laboratory. The animals were acclimated for 10 days before the start of the study.

Husbandry details: Animals were housed in wire mesh cages, at 21°C, with a 12h light dark cycle (starting light at 8 am) and had food ad libitum.

Strategy to minimise confounders: animals were randomly divided into three groups, using stratified randomisation. The cages were randomly placed in the husbandry and received a colour coding to designate groups. Investigators were blinded to the colour significance. Test time was between 08.30am to 12.30pm and testing order was randomized daily, with each animal tested at a different time each test day.
info_icon_sample_size_calculation:
Links to sample size calculation tool + example of what we expect: https://clincalc.com/stats/samplesize.aspx

The ARRIVE guidelines gives two examples of sample size calculation in their guidelines:

'The sample size calculation was based on postoperative pain numerical rating scale (NRS) scores after administration of buprenorphine (NRS AUC mean = 2.70; noninferiority limit = 0.54; standard deviation = 0.66) as the reference treatment…and also Glasgow Composite Pain Scale (GCPS) scores…using online software (Experimental design assistant; https://eda.nc3rs.org.uk/eda/login/auth. The power of the experiment was set to 80%. A total of 20 dogs per group were considered necessary.' [1]

Example 2

'We selected a small sample size because the bioglass prototype was evaluated in vivo for the first time in the present study, and therefore, the initial intention was to gather basic evidence regarding the use of this biomaterial in more complex experimental designs.'[2]
info_icon_randomisation:
For an explanation of different randomisation methods and their advantages, please refer yourself to one of the following links: http://www.3rs-reduction.co.uk/html/5__avoiding_bias.html, http://www.3rs-reduction.co.uk/html/9__experimental_designs.html and https://arriveguidelines.org/arrive-guidelines/randomisation/4a.

Example of randomisation: At allocation: animals will be randomly divided into four groups by using a randomly generated sequence made on random.org
info_icon_blinding:
For an explanation of the concept of blinding and its advantage, see here

During the experiment: treatment will be prepared by a technician and handed over to the investigator giving the intervention, to keep them blinded.

During outcomes assessment: pathologists were blinded to the slides they scored.

Sometimes blinding cannot be performed, but it needs to be justified, e.g. differences in animal fur colour, measuring integrated devices, health states
info_icon_additional_information:
Examples:

Inclusion/exclusion criteria:

  • Based on animal welfare characteristics: if rats weight goes below 200g within 1 week after treatment, they will be withdrawn from the study.
  • Based on task performance: mice completing the moris maze water test within less than 1 min, will be included in the rest of the study where they undergo another cognitive memory test.

Statistical analysis:

  • Group will be compared with a student t-test (STATA), with p>0.05 significance level.

Further randomisation and blinding techniques:

  • At allocation: researchers will be blinded to group allocation, which will be colour coded by an animal caretaker.
  • During the experiment: treatment will always be provided between 14h-17h. Animals will be picked randomly to receive treatment.
  • During outcomes assessment: Histological slides will be assessed in a random order to prevent bias.

lift_embargo_description: You have currently saved your study under embargo. Since your study is now published, can the embargo be lifted?

help_intro: Here, you can find several frequently asked questions and their answers in the submenu's to the left. For a step by step approach, please look at our 'How to' document. If your question isn't answered here, please contact us or set up an appointment for online live support with our helpdesk: here.

password_could_not_be_changed: Your password could not be changed. Contact us if this issue persists.
tick_box: Please tick the statement below and fill in the free text box to request the extension.
request_embargo_description: I demand to extend the embargo of my protocol for an additional year
embargo_extend_reason: This demand will be reviewed and approved by one of our administrators, which is why you need to state a reason for the extension.
embargo_extend_note: To note: we want to promote transparency as most as possible. Therefore extension request for a 4th year of embargo, i.e. demand for a 3rd extension, will only be approved for specific cases and must be strongly motivated above.
embargo_extension_note: To note: we want to promote transparency as most as possible. Therefore extension request for a 4th year of embargo, i.e. demand for a 3rd extension, will only be approved for specific cases and must be strongly motivated above.
embargo_extension_request_sent: Your request was sent. As soon as it is approved, you will receive a confirmation e-mail. Approval may take a few days.
receive_message_notifications: I want to receive notifications about new messages
